Judicature (Amentment) Act, No. 37 of 1979 [Certified on Sth June, 1979] a LD—O 20/73 AN ACT TO AMEND THE Jupicatuae Act, No, 2 oF 1978. ‘BE it enacted by the Parliament of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sei Lanka as follows :—~
1. ‘This Act may be cited as the Judicature (Amendment) Short title. Act, No, 37 of 1979,

2 Section 23 of the Judicature Act, No, 2 of 1974, herein- Replacement alter referred to as the "principal enactment”, is hereby 98 Serlloy vepealed and the following new section substituted No 2 of therefor :— . © Appeals 23, Any party who shall be dissatisfied with

any judgment, decree, or order pronounced by a District Court may (excepting where such right is expressly disallowed) appeal to the Court of Appeal against any such judg- ment, decree, or order from any error in law or in fact committed by such court, but ‘no such appeal shall have the effect of staying the execution of such judgment, decree, oc order untess the District Judge shall see. iit to make an order to that effect, in which case the party appellant shall enter into a bond, with or without sureties as the District Judge shall consider necessary, to appear when required and abide the judgment of the Court of Appeal upon the appeal.”. .

Replacement 4, Section 29 of the principal enactment is hereby Steeeton 39 repealed and the following mew section substituted penipal, therefor: . “Procedure 29. (1) All proceedings in a Family Court Sanz shall be instituted and conducted as expedi- + tioualy se possible in accordance with such regulations us may be preseribed :
Provided that until such regulations have been so prescribed, the court shall, as far as. precticable, follow the provisions relating to muamery procedure fm the Civil Procedure Code.

(2) The provisions of the Adoption of Children Ordinance and the Maintenance Opdinance governing the institution and conducting of proceedings under the said ‘Ordinances shall be deemed to apply to such proceedings that may be instituted in the Pamily Courts.

(3) AN applications for the care and custody of minor children shall take prece- dence over all other matters in every Family Court and shail, unless exceptional oircums- tances so warrant, be heard from day to day to ensure the expeditious disposal of the same.”.
